commits.comment: NO-JIRA: add structure for new jms client development
NO-JIRA: add very simple initial proof-of-concept for a proton-based client, from investigation by Rob Godfrey and myself.
NO-JIRA: add an initial .gitignore file
NO-JIRA: dos2unix
NO-JIRA: require Java 1.7. This is necessary in order to implement JMS 2

NO-JIRA: made Main a JUnit test that also stops the driver, laying the groundwork for getting some proper tests up and running Also general source clean-up: - Implemented toString() in several classes - Created SimplePredicate class that can produce diagnostic information if waitFor(..) times out - Removed whitespace, added missing annotations etc.
NO-JIRA: fixed race condition in AmqpConnectionDriver that caused Driver.wakeup calls to be ignored. Also added simple stop mechanism to AmqpConnectionDriver Also minor logging etc changes
QPIDJMS-2: test svn to JIRA integration with basic commit message
QPIDJMS-2: test svn to JIRA integration with cross-project reference to QPID-4891
QPIDJMS-2: test svn to JIRA integration with cross-project reference to PROTON-321
QPIDJMS-2: remove test file
QPIDJMS-3: now waking up the driver when we stop it, so that Connection.close() completes promptly

QPIDJMS-3: Added TestAmqpPeer for use in integration tests, and the first cut of ConnectionIntegrationTest. Also added generated frame and matchers classes (and the xsl used to generate them for potential future use).
QPIDJMS-3: enhanced integration tests to include creating a session, a message producer, and sending a message. Several of our classes now implement the relevant JMS interfaces.
QPIDJMS-4: add findbugs configuration
QPIDJMS-3: got message consumption integration test working

QPIDJMS-3: some minor cleanup and rationalisation, replace PHTODO with TODO in comments to leverage standard IDE etc matching rules, use 'Not Implemented' in exception message to avoid duplicate TODO pickup by tools.
QPIDJMS-9: initial work on Message implementation and mapping to/from AMQP messages
QPIDJMS-9: simplify null TextMessage content to just use an amqp-value section containing null
QPIDJMS-9: start on basic application properties support
QPIDJMS-9: implement the remaining get/setFooProperty methods from Message, expand message tests accordingly.
QPIDJMS-9: add support for the durable header field in messages, ensure the producer sets/overrides this as necessary

QPIDJMS-9: flesh out support for incoming TextMessages using amqp data section, add unit testing of text messages and tweak the *Test class heirarchy and setUp overridding to ease examination of console output
QPIDJMS-9: round out BytesMessage handling of amqp data section, add unit testing
QPIDJMS-9: reorder some code for clarity
QPIDJMS-9: add Message support for JMSDestination operations, with associated handling for producers and consumers
QPIDJMS-9: add Message support for JMSTimestamp operations, with associated handling for producers
QPIDJMS-9: rework message-annotation methods, change method keys to be in terms of strings, add unit testing
QPIDJMS-9: consolidate sender test classes
QPIDJMS-9: expand Destination impl somewhat, begin tramsitting and using type information to allow fully reproducing the Destination objects
QPIDJMS-9: update handling of TextMessage created from data section

QPIDJMS-9: add support for JMSReplyTo, add use of consumer destination to aid JMSDestination/JMSReplyTo destination type/value discovery when we cant get the type from the type-related annotations or the 'to' field isnt set on the message
QPIDJMS-9: add support for sending/receiving messages with expiry, via the absolute-expiry-time field of the properties section and the ttl field of the header section

QPIDJMS-9: update JMSExpiration to use absolute-expiry-time or 'current time + TTL' and NOT 'creation-time + ttl' as this would incorrectly lead to an earlier-than-desired JMSExpiration value because the TTL field is mutable during transit and creation-time is not.
QPIDJMS-9: simplify handling of header.ttl-derived JMSDestination, also allowing the header.ttl field to be manipulated independently of the JMSDestination value
QPIDJMS-9: add ability to set the AMQP ttl field independently of the producer-applied Time To Live value which populates JMSExpiration

QPIDJMS-9: add support for setting the AMQP header ttl field on outgoing messages independently of the value normally applied as result of the JMS producers TTL, using the JMS_AMQP_TTL vendor property
QPIDJMS-9: add basic support for clearProperties(), sans state checking
QPIDJMS-9: add support for messages with priority
QPIDJMS-9: add unit test to verify sender sets JMSPriority on message
NO-JIRA: update dependencies to account for recent proton module changes, generally tidy things up
QPIDJMS-9: initial work on message-id (and eventually correlation-id) handling
QPIDJMS-9: tidy up message tests to remove their direct use/knowledge of the test message classes
QPIDJMS-11: configure RAT plugin + report, fix files it identified as missing the licence header
QPIDJMS-9: use new UnsignedLong.valueOf(BigInteger) method since added to Proton.
QPIDJMS-9: set JMSMessageID when sending. Initial work on correlation-id handling.
QPIDJMS-9: add integration tests for recieving messages with correlation-id, and basic string test for sending. Add/reword javadoc and split unit tests to be more clearer and more specific.
QPIDJMS-9: initial work on decoding JMSMessageIDs on incoming messages then used as JMSCorrelationID values on outgoing messages, enabling type retention for the transmitted AMQP correlation-id value
QPIDJMS-9: consolidate the correlationId and messageId setters/getters, tweak id conversion for ulong
QPIDJMS-9: fix constants and method names relating to the ulong id conversion
QPIDJMS-12: add configuration for jacoco to check coverage
QPIDJMS-9: work on binary message-id/correlation-id handling, etc
QPIDJMS-9: remove stale comments
QPIDJMS-9: implement get/setJMSCorrelationIDAsBytes
QPIDJMS-9: update exception behaviour for setJMSCorrelationID, tweak javadoc on helper class to more closely cover its usage
QPIDJMS-9: implement get/setJMSType methods
QPIDJMS-9: add some missing testing around handling of missing properties
QPIDJMS-9: implement read-only mode for properties of received messages
QPIDJMS-9: implement validation that property names meet the identifier requirements
QPIDJMS-9: work on support for JMSXUserID
QPIDJMS-9: add some additional tests for JMSXUserID, consolidate MFE creation into utility methods
QPIDJMS-9: move responsibility for implementing clearBody() to the concrete message classes
QPIDJMS-9: work on support for JMSXGroupID
QPIDJMS-9: initial work on implementing JMSXGroupSeq
flesh out JMSXGroupSeq, e.g getter and handle group-sequence values above the int limit
QPIDJMS-9: some small cleanup, add some additional tests
QPIDJMS-9: ensure to clear up fields for JMSXUserID, JMSXGroupID, JMSXGroupSeq when clearing properties
QPIDJMS-9: add support for setting/getting the reply-to-group-id value using the synthetic JMS_AMQP_REPLY_TO_GROUP_ID vendor property
QPIDJMS-9: add an integration test for sending messages with group properties set
QPIDJMS-14: round out TextMessage support, add verification of message body state and implement clearBody()
QPIDJMS-15: add read-only/write-only checking and reset/clearBody support for BytesMessage
QPIDJMS-15: ensure that getBodyLength() handles changes from calling reset on a message after writing to it
QPIDJMS-15: initial implementation and tests for most of the remaining BytesMessage methods
QPIDJMS-15: implement the asymmetric unsigned byte/short methods
QPIDJMS-15: ensure we always throw the required IOOBE's, those raised as side effects of the method natural implementation dont account for some corner cases
QPIDJMS-15: split input and output stream handling out to utility classes, enhance tests
QPIDJMS-15: support for sending a previously received BytesMessage, add/tidy up related integration tests
QPIDJMS-15: support conversion when sending a BytesMessage previously received from a non-JMS client using an alternative body representation
QPIDJMS-16: update to use the current qpid-parent snapshot, which will need to be locally installed in the mean time
NO-JIRA: fix compilation after recent updates to the Proton factories
QPIDJMS-16: remove redundant groupId element, inherit parent value
QPIDJMS-16: change to using the qpid-parent 1.0 release pom
QPIDJMS-18: initial work on implementing ObjectMessage
QPIDJMS-18: update other exception handling to match previous commit
QPIDJMS-18: make order of constructor args consistent
QPIDJMS-20: initial work on using AMQP type encoding for sent/received ObjectMessage
QPIDJMS-21: initial work on implementing the MapMessage interface
QPIDJMS-21: implement support for byte[] entries, use LinkedHashMap for predictable ordering behaviour, add additional tests.
QPIDJMS-21, QPIDJMS-20: update the message type identification process
NO-JIRA: add a TODO for setting JMSDeliveryTime during send
NO-JIRA: fix compilation following changes on proton trunk
NO-JIRA: improve output of channel info when the matcher fails, help clarify what didnt meet expectation
NO-JIRA: update tests to handle new behaviour from recent proton-j changes
QPIDJMS-22: initial work on implementing StreamMessage
QPIDJMS-23: move existing findbugs-maven-plugin usage into its own profile
QPIDJMS-22: round out basic StreamMessage support
QPIDJMS-24: redirect test output to file, allowing use of -Dmaven.test.redirectTestOutputToFile=false to restore console output if desired
QPIDJMS-23: update to use findbugs[-maven-plugin] 3.0.0
QPIDJMS-25: initial experimenting with Netty integration
QPIDJMS-25: update to support staged SASL negotiation rather than an immediately pipelined ANONYMOUS exchange, depends on some uncommitted PROTON SASL hacks/tweaks
QPIDJMS-25: cleanup/fixups/formatting
QPIDJMS-25: add some sample config to the pom for enabling additional proton framing trace during tests
QPIDJMS-25: cleanup, disable debug logging by default, add temp event handling code to remove dependency on proton-j-demo
QPIDJMS-25: write pending output after completing a read, works around lack of events during SASL (and receiving a flow after doing a buffered send) allowing use of proton trunk again
QPIDJMS-25: remove the previous ACD
QPIDJMS-26: initial update of session and link open+close handling to use the events API
QPIDJMS-26: initial update of connection open+close handling to use the events API
QPIDJMS-27: initial work on using events to signal operation completion
QPIDJMS-27: update link closing to use events to signal completion
QPIDJMS-27: update connection closing to use events to signal completion
QPIDJMS-27: update message sending to use events to signal completion
QPIDJMS-26: update message receiver to use delivery events to provoke initial processing
QPIDJMS-26: add basic consumer credit replenishment
QPIDJMS-28: add initial utils drain and spout, temp location
QPIDJMS-25: separate raw byte logging from the logger used for the other messages
QPIDJMS-25: fix write size logging, add logging when write request is not successful
QPIDJMS-25: move any 'write after read' work out of the netty IO thread, avoid them jumping application-initiated writes
NO-JIRA: configure the frame size, increase session incoming capacity to max
NO-JIRA: move existing files into a module dir
NO-JIRA: update artifactId to match dir name
NO-JIRA: remove empty dir
Small change to suppress warnings for unused variables
QPIDJMS-2: add test file
QPIDJMS-2: remove test file
QPIDJMS-2: add test file again
Initial drop of donated AMQP Client Code.
QPIDJMS-2: remove test file again
Use a more OSGI friendly way of creating Vert.x which also allows use of more recent Vert.x versions if we need to work around issues until we switch over to Netty
update the ID helper to use the proton types directory rather than converting them
initial work on allowing the AMQP message facade to handle the various AMQP message-id and correlation-id types
Add destination accessor
Implement get / set of JMS Destination from the AMQP message facade
Add some notes
Add mock return for consumer.getDestination
Initial stab at message copy, still needs work.
Cleanup the method names to make them consistent.

Add getters and setters for the To and ReplyTo address values from the underlying AMQP message to the message facade and use those in destination helper.  Create a new test to start covering the variations of things in AmqpDestinationHelper
Adding in more tests for the destination helper
Additional tests for helper methods.
Add tests for the address set methods.
small refactor for clarity, add note about exception handling
reduce JmsMessageId to a single constructor
make the inbound messsage envelope part of the Id heirachy
use the message envelopes to track deliveries etc, remove JmsMessageId class and have the facades use String for messageid
Add try/catch in ack for delviered case, this should also signal that the provider has an unrecoverable error, a failover provider won't signal error here only a direct connect.
update set/getCorrelationIDAsBytes methods to use Binary objects
Implement a proper copy for the message object

Use a JmsQueue as a fallback when no type annotations are present and we can't deduce from consumer.  This provides a JMS complaint result which doesn't impact how the Broker is really managing that destination.
Add some additional tests to validate handling null values behaves as expected.

Test basic message property for AmqpJmsMessageFacade.  Fix up a few null check issues, and use the AmqpJms facade types as covariant return types from the copy methods to make testing easier, no casts needed.
Additional check to filter out replyToGroupId if its an empty string also.
Test for number of message properties and fix copy incorrectly mapping replyTo into the replyToGroupId feild.
Start testing the AmqpJmsMessagePropertIntercepter.  Work in progress as the object message type bits are complete.
add a note
fix exception message to state correct range
update envelope toString/equals/hashCode implementations, add sequence number and tweak facade to avoid message-id conversion cost for envelope use
add some tests for JmsInboundMessageDispatch
Fix issue with clearing destination bits when called with null
Finish the property intercepter bits around ObjectMessage serialization vs AMQP typed values.
add some support for messages arriving without the annotation to signal JMS message type
fix population of creation-time field of propertie section, via sender using setJMSTimestamp
update facade and property interceptor to fix propertyExists(), handle properties that do exist with a null value
add a note for later
Remove the ActiveMQ test deps as those are in the interop module now.
Create our own selector parser lib based on apollo-selector
Create separate methods for message prop in the case of send vs dispatch so that we can have distinct processing logic for those cases.
Couple little code format cleanups.
Correct method comments.
Fix spelling error in comment.
Removing of HawtBuf usage.
Remove use of HawtBuf
Remove use of HawtBuf
Remove use of HawtBuf
Remove all uses of HawtBuf and remove it as a dependency for the project.
Create the message level Destination and ReplyTo objects lazily since we may never need them if the client doesn't call getJMSDestination or getJMSReplyTo, pushes off the work to the client threads.
Add some initial testing and cleanup around JmsMessagePropertyIntercepter
Add tests for the default cases when doing a Get
fix empty list initialization on new stream message facades
add support for [single] amqp-sequence bodies
stop application properties being overwritten when retrieving the contents from the facade
update provider factory error logging, correct class and include exception toString as further aid
add some logging of test phases to aid debugging
use the x-opt-jms-type annotation for transmitting the JMSType header
add toString for the selector filter
only set the message format property when using the transformer proces that needs it
use AmqpJmsMessageBuilder to create incoming messages, remove transformer usage
switch to using the the AMQP message facades
add temporary ignore on test
ensure facade copy includes consumer destination

Remove use of the default message factory from the FailoverProvider and make it dependent on the connected instance for the message factory instance.  Also adds a new event onConnectionEstablished which allows the providers to know when chained that the next one in the series has connected and allows for a client level event to indicate same.
Remove all Proton-JMS and use just Proton-J constructs.
Add some tests for property set intercepters
Adds additional tests for property get intercepters
enable test again after applying fix to proton-jms
More property intercepter tests and some fixes.
Start a bit of cleanup around delivery / redelivery count, keep all logic in the facade and just call into it from property intercepter and JMS message objects.
Set the content type as defined in the JMS mapping spec.
clear the content type value on create to match the requirements in the JMS mapping spec.
fix copy method broken in last commit
Use a single Netty buffer to read all message bytes and grow as needed.
Enforce content type always set to java serialized value.
Don't send error or close events if transport is already closed.
Clean some old comments.
clean up method names in the factories.
Move all the default implementations now used only for tests into the tests package.
enable various tests now that the relevant functionality is implemented
add missing test
use a plain Message rather than TextMessage
stop the consumer always overriding the 'to' field by setting JMSDestination, enable/add more tests
ensure the ttl header field is populated appropriate based on JMSExpiration or JMS_AMQP_TTL usage, enable test that was failing
obey requests to disable including timestamp on the message even if ttl is enabled
update tests to check field values are within a certain delta
Remove code that was only needed for use with the JMS transformer sends.
simplify handling of ttl field, add tests to check we reject out of range values
add tests for sending messges with ttl override in effect
fix facade copy when ttl override value exists
fix synthetic ttl check issue exposed by tests after prior commit
Refactor send handling a bit, do all message prep in client thread during the onSend method.  Pass producer configuation to message onSend so the facade can decide what to include in sent message.
Delegate the work of creating a proper JMS Destination when setting the destination or reply to address via a Message object's setStringProperty or setObjectProperty methods.
Initial implementation and test for creating a destination from string using connection destination prefix values.

Do some code cleanup.

process the new link detach events
update test peer to close rather than detach links when asked

Refactor of BytesMessage handling to make the message facade more opaque to the JmsBytesMessage instance which allows for handling of message content scenarios being fully contained in the facade implementation.
Add some variations of anonymous send tests.
More correct equals and hashCode
Adds an initial implementation of producer caching for anonymous producers.  Added options to AmqpConnection to enable / disable and a configurable cache size value.

Push proirity scaling to the facade class and do proper in / out scaling in the AMQP facade.  Enable test for get out of range value.
Update priority scaling to handle values above the signed byte range. Change methods to use int so facades see original value, contain any casting to within facade.
add some more header priority tests

add some tests for handling of Properties section creation-time

ensure that clearing properties clears the property-defined group sequence value of the facade

Clean up in JmsMessage a bit, adds more test coverage.

Remove an unneeded public accessor and just make the calls directly in the AmqpConsumer
Add extra test cases to fully cover equals.
Enforce strings only for setting JMSXUserID and add tests for more of the interceptor methods and scenarios.
Fix issue when setting delivery mode from string, add more tests to cover.
remove testonly setBody method, update tests accordingly

test input/output stream state checking
simplify setting the encoding method and ensure it is a no-op if the method is unchanged

more unit tests for AmqpJmsObjectMessageFacade

Finish covering JMS message property handling tests pulling in old tests from previous client work.

Removing the isExpired method from JmsMessage.  Will need to add something to the message facade later to allow a consumer to check prior to dispatch to ensure that prefetched messages get filtered if they expired while sitting in the buffer.  Something along message.getFacade().isExpired()
Test the equals and hashCode bits.
Capture and throw correct errors from BytesMessage read and write methods, adds tests to cover these.

Add some testing and some notes about cleanup of delivery / redelivery count methods in the message facades.
Cover text message code with tests for isEmpty
Started work on some refactoring of clearProperties and the property intercepter to make things simpler.  Some TODO entries added to indicate where more work is still needed.
Started adding in the clear bits to the AMQP intercetper also.
Finish work on refactoring the Amqp message property intercepter and updated tests to mock out the needed bits.
Add tests for new clear calls.
Fix the test case.
Add some additional test cases to ensure errors are trapped.  Remove unneeded check for null.
Add some initial support for gathing connection capabilities and properties into a config object.  Start on real anonymous producer support.
Start work on testing and improving the JMS transformation utility which handles conversions of foreign messages and destinations.
Complete path coverage of destination transformation method.
Create a raw Message type, not a TextMessage

Clean up comments and API documentation.

Add the ability for adding in a custom intercepter to manage conversion of foreign destination types that we don't know how to convert ourselves.  Default implementation will look for isTopic or isQueue method in the class before giving up.  Add some tests around this.
Throw JMSException is the destinatio name is null.
Add some additional tests for handling unresolved foreign destination types.
title and organise into sections of related tests
add message to assertion to aid during test failure
add note about need to check limit to prevent excess provider creation attempts

Tests for stat exception thrown when connection is closed.
Create a specialized session object used soley by the connection to provide a place for things like durable unsubscribe, etc.
Do some cleanup and renaming to make things more consistent.
remove stale comment, add some tests around the disableMessageId/disableTimestamp producer hints

Extract some common bits into a utility base class.
fix typo that got c&p across everything

streamline test, other elements have their own specific tests

A functional durable subscription removal mechanism.  Show where we need some cleanup work and also looks to show a problem with handling on the broker side when the durable sub is not removable due to in use.
Fix the case where unsubscribe fails and then is reattempted and can succeed.
start on session integration test for temporary queues
extract a common base class for matching of descriptor and field values
consolodate a couple of the frame matcher superclasses
update test peer handling enough to make test pass, and add additional check that TemporaryQueue object reflects given dynamic address
update generated matchers to actually match the current XSL template
create new matchers to allow verifying sub-values within the source and target values of the Attach frame
update expectations for temporary-queue creation to match on values of the Attach target
update temporary destination creation to use link-detach expiry, allowing us to delete them by detaching the creating link later
add check for temp queue terminus durability
start on brokerless integration test for durable subscribers
limit default channel-max to the signed short range for compatibility
add definitions to testpeer for some of the basic terminus field types and their values
update the testpeer to use the new constants rather than literals
add transaction related files generated by existing XSL
add some more delivery state types
add some more transaction related types
add some more transaction related types
add the more general error-condition archetype rather than just transaction-error specifically

update xsl name
add the error type
add dynamic node lifetime policies
add transactional-state matcher
Add a little bit more validation to the durable subscribe test.
Add a NoOpAsyncResult class to use for out of band async operation where we don't care about the end result.

Implement proper durable topic unsubscribe.  Also ensures that for a durable subscriber we detach and not close when the MessageConsumer is closed.  Tests will continue to work with ActiveMQ as it removes subscriptions on the first reattach attempt and does not currently do a remove on close.  Some of the AmqpResource code is a bit messy now and needs to be refactored a bit after this change.
update to use new type classes for matching
Update anonymous relay to use a target with null address in line with Addressing spec direction. Relies on update to broker to enable support. Needs finishing.
add support to test peer for refusing producer links
encapsulate the endpoint field
add test of behaviour when link is refused, i.e null source in attach response
add incomplete test of anonymous producer behaviour when the anonymous-relay node is not supported
verify a non-null terminus during producer open completion, fail if otherwise
temporarily disable the tests that fail due to requiring an outstanding patch to broker side anonymous relay behaviour
add option to group multiple frames into a single attempted TCP write, use to optionally defer the attach response until the detach is ready too
remove producers map that isnt currently really used
update anonymous producers to attempt using the anonymous relay and then fall back to opening and closing links if unsuccessfull
enable tests using anonymous producers again, now that they will fall back to opening and closing links if trying the anonymous relay fails.
fixup config for controlling producer settlement
update test to perform repeat send to observe continued use of link to the anonymous-relay
finish test of anonymous producer behaviour when the anonmous-relay node is not supported, observe link attach and detach/close for repeated sends
enable deciding whether a detach frame should be responded to, as it might be a response frame we are expecting
fix session closed exception message
update tests to expect detach responses during link rejection, update implementation to send them
